member.summary: Represents the directory entry size in bytes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.NoStream
member.summary: An int value indicates the there is no stream.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry._streamSize2
member.summary: For a version 3 compound file with 512-byte sector size, the high DWORD MAY be uninitialized or non-zero. Implementations MUST ignore the high DWORD when reading a version 3 compound file, and MUST set the high DWORD to zero when writing a version 3 compound file.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.Name
member.summary: This field MUST contain a Unicode string for the storage or stream name encoded in UTF-16. The name MUST be terminated with a UTF-16 NUL character. Thus storage and stream names are limited to 32 UTF-16 code points, including the NUL terminator character. When locating an object in the compound file except for the root storage, the directory entry name is compared using a special case-insensitive upper-case mapping, described in Red-Black Tree. The following characters are illegal and MUST NOT be part of the name: '/', '\', ':', '!'.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.CreationTime
member.summary: This field contains the creation time for a storage object. The Windows FILETIME structure is used to represent this field in UTC. If there is no creation time set on the object, this field MUST be all zeroes. For a root storage object, this field MUST be all zeroes, and the creation time is retrieved or set on the compound file itself.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.ModifiedTime
member.summary: This field contains the modification time for a storage object. The Windows FILETIME structure is used to represent this field in UTC. If there is no modified time set on the object, this field MUST be all zeroes. For a root storage object, this field MUST be all zeroes, and the modified time is retrieved or set on the compound file itself.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.NodeColor
member.summary: This field MUST be 0x00 (red) or 0x01 (black).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.Type
member.summary: This field MUST be 0x00, 0x01, 0x02, or 0x05, depending on the actual type of object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.LeftSiblingID
member.summary: This field contains the Stream ID of the left sibling. If there is no left sibling, the field MUST be set to NOSTREAM (0xFFFFFFFF).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.RightSiblingID
member.summary: This field contains the Stream ID of the right sibling. If there is no right sibling, the field MUST be set to NOSTREAM (0xFFFFFFFF).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.ChildID
member.summary: This field contains the Stream ID of a child object. If there is no child object, then the field MUST be set to NOSTREAM (0xFFFFFFFF).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.StartSector
member.summary: This field contains the first sector location if this is a stream object. For a root storage object, this field MUST contain the first sector of the mini stream, if the mini stream exists.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.DirectoryEntry.StreamSize
member.summary: This 64-bit integer field contains the size of the user-defined data, if this is a stream object. For a root storage object, this field contains the size of the mini stream.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.Size
member.summary: An int value indicates the size of compound file header.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.MaxDifatArrayLength
member.summary: An int value indicates the max length of DIFAT in header.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.SectorSize
member.summary: This field MUST be set to 0x0009, or 0x000c, depending on the Major Version field. This field specifies the sector size of the compound file as a power of 2.
member.remarks: If Major Version is 3, then the Sector Shift MUST be 0x0009, specifying a sector size of 512 bytes If Major Version is 4, then the Sector Shift MUST be 0x000C, specifying a sector size of 4096 bytes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.MiniSectorSize
member.summary: This field MUST be set to 0x0006. This field specifies the sector size of the Mini Stream as a power of 2. The sector size of the Mini Stream MUST be 64 bytes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.FatSectorCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the main BAT(block allocation table) count, every main BAT block contains some block indexes which used to find the sectors that contain block allocation table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.FirstDirectorySector
member.summary: This integer field contains the starting sector number for the Storage Stream.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.MiniStreamCutoffSize
member.summary: This integer field MUST be set to 0x00001000. This field specifies the maximum size of a user-defined data stream allocated from the mini FAT and mini stream, and that cutoff is 4096 bytes. Any user-defined data stream larger than or equal to this cutoff size must be allocated as normal sectors from the FAT.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.FirstMiniFatSector
member.summary: This integer field contains the starting sector number for the mini FAT.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.MiniFatSectorCount
member.summary: This integer field contains the mini sector count for the mini FAT.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.FirstDifatSector
member.summary: This integer field contains the starting sector number for the DIFAT.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.DifatSectorCount
member.summary: This integer field contains the count of the number of DIFAT sectors in the compound file.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Encryption.CompoundFileHeader.DifatArray
member.summary: This array of 32-bit integer fields contains the first 109 FAT sector locations of the compound file.

member.summary: Returns or sets the shape used with the 3-D bar or column chart.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether visible cells are plotted. True if only visible cells are plotted. False if both visible and hidden cells are plotted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.DisplayBlanksAs
member.summary: Returns or sets the way that blank cells are plotted on a chart. Can be one of the following: constants: NotPlotted, Interpolated, or Zero.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.Elevation
member.summary: Returns or sets the elevation of the 3-D chart view in degrees.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.GapDepth
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance between the data series in a 3-D chart as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.HasLegend
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart has a legend.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the axis or chart has a visible title.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.HeightPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective for the 3-D chart view. Must be between 0 and 100. This property is ignored if the Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel._Chart.RightAngleAxes property is True.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart axes are at right angles, independent of chart rotation or elevation. Applies only to 3-D line, column, and bar charts.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.Rotation
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis in degrees). The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChart.ShowDataLabelsOverMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show the data labels when the value is greater than the maximum value on the value axis.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.IChartArea
member.summary: Represents the chart area of a chart. The chart area on a 2-D chart contains the axes, the chart title, the axis titles, and the legend. The chart area on a 3-D chart contains the chart title and the legend; it doesn’t include the plot area (the area within the chart area where the data is plotted). For information about formatting the plot area, see the object.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.ISeriesCollection.Add(GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IRange,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.RowCol)
member.summary: Adds one or more new series to the collection.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.ISeriesCollection.Add(GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IRange,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.RowCol,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds one or more new series to the collection.
member.param: The new data, either as a Range object or an array of data points.
Specifies whether the new values are in the rows or columns of the specified range.
True if the first row or column contains the name of the data series. False if the first row or column contains the first data point of the series.
True if the first row or column contains the name of the category labels. False if the first row or column contains the first data point of the series.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.ISeriesCollection.Extend(GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IRange,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.RowCol,System.Boolean)

member.param: The new data to be added to the object
Specifies whether the new values are in the rows or columns of the given range source. Can be one of the constants: Rows or Columns.
True to have the first row or column contain the name of the category labels. False to have the first row or column contain the first data point of the series.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType
member.summary: Specifies how the trendline that smoothes out fluctuations in the data is calculated.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.Logarithmic
member.summary: Uses the equation y = c ln x + b to calculate that the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.Linear
member.summary: Uses the linear equation y = mx + b to calculate that the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.Polynomial
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate that the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.Power
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate that the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.Exponential
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate that the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.Drawing.TrendlineType.MovingAvg
member.summary: Uses a sequence of averages computed from parts of the data series. The number of points equals the total number of points in the series less the number specified for the period.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that it is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and set members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a of property.

member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DataBarAxisPosition
member.summary: Specifies the axis position for a range of cells with conditional formatting as data bars.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DataBarAxisPosition.None
member.summary: Specifies that no axis is displayed, and both positive and negative values are displayed in the left-to-right direction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DataBarAxisPosition.Automatic
member.summary: Displays the axis at a variable position based on the ratio of the minimum negative value to the maximum positive value in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction. When all values are positive or all values are negative, no axis is displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.DataBarAxisPosition.Midpoint
member.summary: Displays the axis at the midpoint of the cell regardless of the set of values in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IFormatCondition.Priority
member.summary: Returns or sets the priority value of the conditional formatting rule. The priority determines the order of evaluation when multiple conditional formatting rules exist in a worksheet.
member.remarks: When setting the priority, the value must be a positive integer between 1 and the total number of conditional formatting rules on the worksheet. The priority must be a unique value for all rules on the worksheet, so changing the priority for the specified conditional formatting rule may cause the priority value of the other rules on the worksheet to be shifted.

member.summary: Returns or sets a String value specifying the text used by the conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Represents the criteria for the minimum, midpoint, or maximum thresholds for a color format conditional format.

member.summary: Returns a FormatColor object, which specifies the color assigned to the threshold of a color scale conditional format (read-only).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IColorScaleCriterion.Index
member.summary: Returns an Integer value that indicates which threshold the criteria represents (read-only).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IColorScaleCriterion.Type
member.summary: Returns one of the constants of the ConditionValueTypes enumeration, which specifies how the threshold values for a data bar or color scale conditional format are determined (read-only).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IColorScaleCriterion.Value
member.summary: Returns or sets the minimum, midpoint, or maximum threshold value for a color scale conditional format (read or write).
member.remarks: You can set the value only if the ColorScaleCriterion.Type property for the conditional format is set to one of the following constants: ConditionValueNumber, ConditionValuePercent, ConditionValuePercentile, or ConditionValueFormula. If the type of threshold is a formula, you can set the formula as a String. The formula must return a single number.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition
member.summary: Represents an icon set conditional formatting rule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.AppliesTo
member.summary: Returns a Range object that specifies the cell range to which the formatting rule is applied.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.IconCriteria
member.summary: Returns an IconCriteria collection, which represents the set of criteria for an icon set conditional formatting rule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.IconSet
member.summary: Returns or sets an IconSets collection, which specifies the icon set used in the conditional format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.PercentileValues
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value indicating if the thresholds for an icon set conditional format are determined by using percentiles.
member.remarks: This property will return False if not every threshold is set to percentile. Setting this property to True will set every threshold type to percentile.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.Priority
member.summary: Returns or sets the priority value of the conditional formatting rule. The priority determines the order of evaluation when multiple conditional formatting rules exist in a worksheet.
member.remarks: When setting the priority, the value must be a positive integer between 1 and the total number of conditional formatting rules on the worksheet. The priority must be a unique value for all rules on the worksheet, so changing the priority for the specified conditional formatting rule may cause the priority value of the other rules on the worksheet to be shifted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.ReverseOrder
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value indicating if the order of icons is reversed for an icon set.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.ShowIconOnly
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value indicating if only the icon is displayed for an icon set conditional format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.StopIfTrue
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines if additional formatting rules on the cell should be evaluated if the current rule evaluates to True.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Returns the type of this conditional format.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.Delete
member.summary: Deletes this conditional format.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.SetFirstPriority
member.summary: Sets the priority value for this conditional formatting rule to "1" so that it will be evaluated before all other rules on the worksheet.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconSetCondition.SetLastPriority
member.summary: Sets the evaluation order for this conditional formatting rule so it is evaluated after all other rules on the worksheet.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriteria
member.summary: Represents the collection of IconCriterion objects. Each IconCriterion represents the values and threshold type for each icon in an icon set conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Returns a value that specifies the number of criteria for an icon set conditional format rule (read-only).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriteria.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an IconCriterion object from the collection.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriterion
member.summary: Represents the criterion for an individual icon in an icon set. The criterion specifies the range of values and the threshold type associated with the icon in an icon set conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Gets or sets the icon for a criterion in an icon set conditional formatting rule.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriterion.Index
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates which threshold the criteria represents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriterion.Operator
member.summary: Returns or sets one of the constants of the FormatConditionOperator enumeration, which specifes if the threshold is "greater than" or "greater than or equal to" the threshold value.
member.remarks: For an icon set conditional formatting rule, this property can be set to only one of the following two constants: xlGreater or xlGreaterEqual.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriterion.Type
member.summary: Returns one of the constants of the ConditionValueTypes enumeration, which specifies how the threshold value for an icon set is determined (read-only).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IIconCriterion.Value
member.summary: Returns or sets the threshold value for an icon in a conditional format (read or write variant).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IRange.AutoFilter(System.Int32,System.Object,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.AutoFilterOperator,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Filters a list using the AutoFilter.
member.param: Optional Object. The integer offset of the field on which you want to base the filter (from the left of the list; the leftmost field is field one).

Optional Object. The criteria (a string; for example, "101"). Use "=" to find blank fields, or use "<>" to find nonblank fields. If this argument is omitted, the criteria is All. If Operator is xlTop10Items, Criteria1 specifies the number of items (for example, "10").
Optional Object. The second criteria (a string). Used with Criteria1 and Operator to construct compound criteria.
Optional Object. True to display the AutoFilter drop-down arrow for the filtered field; False to hide the AutoFilter drop-down arrow for the filtered field. True by default.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show the detail (Returns True if the outline is expanded for the specified range, so that the detail of the column or row is visible). The specified range must be a single summary column or row in an outline (read or write).
member.remarks: The following statements are true: 1.The range must be in a single summary row or column. 2.This property returns False if any of the children of the row or column are hidden. 3.Setting this property to True is equivalent to unhiding all the children of the summary row or column. 4.Setting this property to False is equivalent to hiding all the children of the summary row or column.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IDisplayFormat
member.summary:
Represents the display settings for an associated Range object.
Remark: Actions such as changing the conditional formatting or table style of a range can cause what is displayed in the current user interface to be inconsistent with the values in the corresponding properties of the Range object. Use the properties of the DisplayFormat object to return the values as they are displayed in the current user interface.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.IDisplayFormat.AddIndent
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates if the application automatically indents text of the associated Range object when the text alignment in a cell is set to equal distribution (either horizontally or vertically), as it is displayed in the current user interface.
Returns: Returns True if text is automatically indented when the text alignment in the cell is set, either horizontally or vertically, to equal distribution.

Condition formatExample
NFPartCond[ NFPartCompOper NFPartCondNum ]
NFPartCompOper(< [= / >]) / = / (> [=])
NFPartCondNum[-] NFPartIntNum [INTL-CHAR-DECIMAL-SEP NFPartIntNum] [NFPartExponential NFPartIntNum]

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.RuleSplitter.GetPointDescriptionTable(GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.CellRect,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.CellRect,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get a table of left-top points of source range.
Mechanism: Suppose the affectRange's position is absolute, and the sourceRange's position is floating. Then, find out that in which position the sourceRange will be cutted on left-top/right-top/left-bottom/right-bottom. Mark the cutting information using enum OperationPoint. And, finally, generate a segment table to describe the information above.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.RuleSplitter.CutPasteUnionFunction(GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.CutPasteDescription,GrapeCity.Documents.Spread.CutPasteDescription)
member.summary:
Clear duplicate points in pasteDesc according to cutDesc, then append PastePoints to cutDesc.
For example: If a point exist both in CutPoints and PastePoints, then the point will be treated as a cutted point, and should be exlude from PastePoints.

Specifies a boolean value that indicates that this field contains text values. The field can also contain a mix of other data types and blank values.
